title: Project-Based Learning for Developing a Classification System of Mathematics Teaching Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental secondary-level mathematics concepts and foundational educational methodologies
context.additional_context: A program where most learners use smartphones as their primary learning tool, aiming to develop a classification system for teaching methods applicable in math education settings

learning_goals: Through literature analysis, the characteristics of existing mathematics teaching method classification systems can be categorized into three types.
Cluster analysis techniques can be used to derive the focus (narrow, comprehensive, multipurpose) of teaching methods.
Optimal classification models can be evaluated by applying classification system validation criteria (internal consistency, user-friendliness, etc.).
A mathematics education-specific classification system can be proposed that incorporates learner-engaged design.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
